skos:Concept.skos:definition: A condensed version of a larger piece of work outlining the major points and conclusions.
A comment (usually added to a text) [Hyperdictionary]

In publishing, an article is a piece of nonfictional prose that is an independent part of a publication (such as a book, journal, magazine, or newspaper). This sense of article overlaps with the usage of the word essay. In an encyclopedia or other reference work, an article is a primary division of content. [Wikipedia]
Anything made by human art and workmanship; an artificial product. [Oxford English Dictionary]
Service where one can submit questions for personal response to either an individual or group of people who have specific expertise in the area of interest.
Resource used to evaluate or measure progress, development, ability, skill, understanding, knowledge, or achievement. [iLumina]
A list often with descriptive or critical notes of writings relating to a particular subject, period, or author. [Merriam-Webster]
Recording of a newscast, talk show, or other oral presentation originally generated via the radio.

Resource offering intensive analysis of an individual unit (as a person or community) stressing developmental factors in relation to environment or a scientific study of a specific location or region.

A detailed study of the development of a particular person, group, or situation over a period of time; a particular instance used to illustrate a thesis or principle. [Compact Oxford English Dictionary]
Resource with links to other sites organized around a topic or topics. [DLESE]
A central agency for the collection, classification, and distribution especially of information; broadly : an informal channel for distributing information or assistance [Merriam-Webster Online]
skos:Concept.skos:editorialNote: Second sentence of DLESE definition deleted

skos:Concept.skos:definition: A set of teaching and learning materials intended to achieve a wide range of objectives over an extended period of time.
A program of study.
A collection of data elements in the form of a list, table, or database intended for use with another learning resource. [iLumina]
An organized collection of data with a common theme. [GIS Dictionary]

Resource that uses a video or audio recording to show or explain a procedure, process, or principle. Note a verbal explanation is not required, the explanation may be implied through an action. This is distinct from simulations in that demonstrations have real objects in them as opposed to representations.
An illustration or explanation, as of a theory or product, by exemplification or practical application. [American Heritage Dictionary, 4th ed.]
A scientific procedure undertaken to make a discovery, test a hypothesis, or demonstrate a known fact. [Compact Oxford English Dictionary]
Prose literature, especially novels, describing imaginary events and people.
skos:Concept.skos:scopeNote: Do not use for technical documentation and guides, or field and instructor's guides
skos:Concept.skos:editorialNote: Eliminated 'book" from the term, moved former definition exclusions to scope note.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: A formatted document containing blank fields that users can fill in with data. [Webopedia]
A meeting or medium for an exchange of views. [Compact Oxford English Dictionary]
An activity designed to teach about a certain subject or help learn a skill. [Wikipedia: Educational games]
An alphabetical list of words relating to a specific subject, text, or dialect, with explanations. [Compact Oxford English Dictionary]
Visual matter used to clarify or decorate a text. [American Heritage Dictionary, 4th ed.]
Supporting resource for teachers regarding the use of learning materials with respect to learning objectives, classroom management, materials, assessment, and additional reference material.

Resource to support students' learning of specific concepts or content. May include teaching instructions (educational goals, learning objectives, procedures, etc.) or resources for direct student use ranging from printable text to interactive online activities.
A specific assignment to a student. (Wordsmyth)
A 2-dimensional representation of a single point in time or space that illustrates fairly static physical features (e.g. topos, soil, road, bedrock maps, etc).
A representation usually on a flat surface of the whole or a part of an area. [Merriam-webster Online]
Vocal, instrumental, or mechanical sounds having rhythm, melody, or harmony. [Merriam-Webster Online]
skos:Concept.skos:scopeNote: Use also for recordings and musical notation.
skos:Concept.skos:editorialNote: Substituted more general definition and added scope note.

skos:Concept.skos:definition: Recorded historical information obtained in interviews concerning personal experiences and recollections.
Publication that is produced on some predictable schedule, such as weekly, monthly or annually.
A picture made by using a camera that records an image on a light-sensitive surface. [Wordsmyth]
Homepage that is the entrance to a large complex website holding a variety of related resources, hosted by a single organization or group of related organizations.
A website considered as an entry point to other websites, often by being or providing access to a search engine. [dictionary.com]
Unit of instruction organized and delivered by an instructor for the purpose of informing a group about a topic.
Something, such as a lecture or speech, that is set forth for an audience. [American Heritage Dictionary, 4th ed.]
Series of tasks or questions posed to the student, as in homework or other assignment.
Activity to extend or apply concepts taught in a course that usually culminates in a product.
A task or problem engaged in usually by a group of students to supplement and apply classroom studies. [Merriam-Webster Online]
A source of information, ranging in size from a large compendium to something that is small and specialized, intended to be used as an authoritative source or to begin to research a topic.
A comprehensive, systematically organized collection of information such as a dictionary, encyclopedia or almanac. [EdNA?]
Imagery generated from measuring devices that are not in direct contact with the medium they are measuring (e.g. radar or satellite imagery).
Detailed account or statement, often outlining the results or events of a meeting, endeavor, activity or study (e.g. review, evaluation).

Imitative representation, such as animations or artificial manipulations of photographs, of the function of a system, process, or principle. Note that the imitative nature of this distinguishes it from a demonstration.
Representation of the operation or features of one process or system through the use of another. [American Heritage Dictionary, 4th ed.]
A guide to provide students with content information and/or hints, techniques, or management ideas in a particular area.

A student tool used to help facilitate learning and comprehension of literature, research topics, history, and other subjects. Most study guides summarize chapters of novels or the important elements of the subject. [Wikipedia]
Plan showing the structure of a particular course, including course description and objectives, grading policy, materials, assignments, lesson sequence, and course calendar.
Resource providing comprehensive materials for specific topics; often includes chapters or other typical book components.
Scholarly work as for an academic degree.
A long essay or dissertation involving personal research, written as part of a university degree. [Compact Oxford English Dictionary]
Resource that provides guided information about a specific subject.
A session or course of concentrated instruction given by a tutor, often on a special topic. [Wordsmyth]

A trip or excursion to a place, often by a group of students or the like, to gain firsthand information, knowledge, or experience. Includes descriptions or plans for actual field trips as well as virtual field trips. [Wordsmyth]
A web-based publication consisting primarily of periodic articles, written by one person or a group. [Wikipedia]
